headline: Why Intuit (INTU) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of tax and accounting software provider, Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) fell 6.5% in the morning session after the company reported weak third-quarter results and provided revenue guidance for the next quarter, which fell short of Wall Street's estimates. Its EPS guidance missed by even more. On the other hand, sales and earnings exceeded expectations during the quarter. Overall, this was a softer quarter, and the stock's reaction suggests markets were expecting stronger guidance following the earn

headline: Intuit CFO talks Q1 earnings, guidance, and tax policy
summary: Despite topping fiscal first quarter estimates on both revenue and earnings, Intuit (INTU) shares are sliding Friday morning on the financial software and tax prep company's second quarter guidance. Intuit CFO Sandeep Aujla joins Brad Smith and Madison Mills to speak more about the print and the company's outlook, especially are taxpayers look ahead to 2025 and are already prepping their tax filings. "Our full-year revenue guidance is 12 to 13% growth. [In] Q1, we did 10%. Our Q2 guidance is 13% to 14% growth," Aujla says. "So meaningful acceleration and positioning us really well to deliver that full-year guidance number. And while we don't guide by each segment when it comes to the quarter, you know, on the Global Business Solutions group, 80% of the revenue is subscription-oriented. So you could continue to expect the momentum continuing. Credit Karma, similarly, expect the momentum to continue adjusted." Aujla also comments on the proposed IRS tax filing app being considered by President-elect Donald Trump's proposed Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), as reported by the Washington Post. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
